jobDescription: Overview  This position may require exposure to information which is subject to US export control regulations, i.e. the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) or the Export Administration Regulations (EAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of U.S. regulations.  An Opportunity to Invent and Innovate  HawkEye 360, a developer of space-based radio frequency (RF) mapping and analytics systems, is currently seeking a Senior Data Scientist who will be part of an important team that designs, implements, supports and utilizes a scalable analytics architecture and complementary analytic products. The team will aim to invent processing components within the analytics architecture to derive data products with commercial potential on topics ranging from behavior characterization and geospatial prediction to visual data representation. The analytics team will also take the lead integrating processed data and analytic products with systems developed by customers and partners.  The Senior Data Scientist will have the primary responsibility of conceiving and implementing analytic components able to leverage data unique to HawkEye 360 to solve critical customer problems. Analytic components may vary from deep convolutional neural networks and bayesian propagation networks to statistical anomaly detection. The Senior Data Scientist will play a role in creating visualizations for results.  Additionally, the Senior Data Scientist may contribute to the efforts of HawkEye 360's processing team, especially as it relates to implementing and analyzing geolocation algorithms. He/She would contribute as a member of the analytics team to the creation and maintenance of the software architecture used to deploy analytic components, as well as to the formation of requirements for this architecture as it evolves.  The Senior Data Scientist reports to the Director of Analytics and interfaces with directors and engineers on the signal processing and space systems teams.
